metadata.synopsis: Two Long Island teens force a roving gambler (Sidney Poitier) to date their maid (Abbey Lincoln), to keep her from quitting.

reviews: What's most irritating is having to watch two first-rate performers waddle around in the prose of this white perspective.
It's an equal opportunity offender: supporting both white and black bourgeois dreams.
This mediocre comedy, starring Poitier, became better known for its Oscar nominated song.
Poitier love story has not aged well.
For Love of Ivy is a warm and delightful comedy. It isn't exactly a masterpiece, but it is well made and I enjoyed it.
...Poitier's always a pleasure to watch, even when the story surrounding him isn't exactly captivating.
